Song: Can't help falling in love
Artist: Elvis Presley
Composers: George David Weiss,
Hugo Peretti and Luigi Creatore 

Tabbed by DJ
23rd July 2015

Time signature: 12/8

CAPO: 2nd fret 
(Will then sound in the original recorded key of D)

The original 1961 studio recording is in D. 
With any live versions the key varies: the 1968
NBC-TV special is in C, as is a 1973 concert too. 
In another live concert in 1972 he sings it in C#
(Capo at 1st fret to match that one).

only have 2 beats, as indicated by the (2) after the chord.  This tab is based on other 
existing tabs, but I have improved the accuracy of the chords and have added timing 
information so that you don't get tripped up by the 2 beat measures.  This is in the 
same key at the recording.  Thanks rich.weber for the accurate chords, avery907 for the 
complete lyrics, and Deeann for suggesting this song!  Turn up the bass!

[solo]

So, here is a REALLY accurate version, as played by Wendy Melvoin (guitarist for The Revolution).
One can clearly see the chord forms she uses in the first-ever live performance of this song, from 1983.
The Fadd9 can be replaced with either a standard F barre chord, or an Fsus2 with the thumb playing the 
low root note on the 6th string, but I would encourage everyone to strive to master the wide-stretch
fingering. The correct chord forms/voicings are integral to getting the sound of this amazing song just  
right, especially the Bbadd9/D and the Ebadd9 voicings.

Thanks and credit to cplemoine for his version, which I used as a template to make this one, and to Youtube 
channel "Shutup & Play" for getting the initial chord right!

        D|-0-|    |-0-|   |-5-|   |-8--|   |-3-|
